name: untitled
description:
// acrylic on paper, 55x60cm, 2019

 > CONTEMPORARY PARIETAL

In the evolution of a planet's fauna, reaching the kind of rational consciousness we experience comes with a need for progress.

Much like the abstract creative process, the building of our psicossocial condition is incremental, but also rooted; improvised, but also interpretative.

I see parietal art as the first visual depiction of longing, of reverse nostalgia, of the wanting to turn materials and minds into an interplanetary civilization.

I try to channel semiautomatic creative energy into aesthetic poetry using the tools I have.
